title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.10-11 | 02-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: O my Lord, you are all powerful...please do me this favor
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 10th verse of the 8th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Uttara's prayer for the protection of her unborn child.

segments.key_quote: Therefore a wife is not allowed to be separated from her husband because the husband is not allowed to be separated from her wife
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is discussed, explaining the context of Uttara's situation after Abhimanyu's death and the concept of 'sati' for chaste wives.

segments.key_quote: Uttara was not ashamed to express this frankly before lord Krishna she very frankly admitted that I want to protect my child kindly save this child
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Uttara's qualities and lineage, emphasizing her role as a mother and a student of Arjuna, highlighting her fortunate position.

segments.key_quote: Having patiently heard her words Lord Shri Krishna who's always very devotees Bhaktavatsala could at once understand that Ashwatthama the son of Dronacharya had thrown the Brahmastra to finish the last life in the Pandava family.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 11th verse, explaining Krishna's understanding of Ashwatthama's use of the Brahmastra to eliminate the Pandava lineage.

segments.key_quote: There is no reason for us to suffer in this material world other than our foolishness of becoming forgetful of Krishna or being rebellious, envious of Krishna, trying to compete with Krishna, trying to assume Krishna's position or trying to be independent of Krishna.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is further discussed, emphasizing the Lord's inclination towards devotees for the well-being of everyone and the importance of reinstating living beings in their original position as loving devotees of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So the Lord takes compassion and he personally comes and he instructs, he speaks the Bhagavad Gita, he sends his representatives and those representatives are being mentioned here.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the compassion of the Lord and his representatives (pure devotees) as the best well-wishers of all living beings.

segments.key_quote: Krishna vanquished the rule of the company of Duryodhana and established the rule of Maharaja Yudhishtira.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why Krishna favored the Pandavas' rule over Duryodhana's, emphasizing the importance of devotion and the welfare of all citizens.

segments.key_quote: Everyone, especially the leaders, become Krishna conscious. That will do good to the entire world.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes with a call for leaders to become Krishna conscious for the well-being and happiness of the entire world.
